content: The Act titled "Personal Holding Company Tax Repeal Act of 2004" repeals the Personal Holding Company Tax. The "Personal Holding Company Tax Repeal Act of 2004" repeals Part II of subchapter G of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 related to personal holding companies. Conforming amendments are made to various sections of the Code. Section 56(b)(2) and Section 170(e)(4)(D) of the Internal Revenue Code are amended by redesignating clauses. Section 111(d) is also amended with special rules for accumulated earnings tax. The tax code sections 316(b), 331(b), and 341(d) are amended to make specific changes, including redesignating paragraphs and updating references to other sections. Section 465(a)(3) of the tax code is amended to define a closely held corporation as one where more than 50% of its stock is owned by not more than 5 individuals. Additionally, new constructive ownership rules are added for this purpose. The tax code defines ownership of stock for corporations, partnerships, estates, and trusts.
